summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2012/10/18
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Daniel Sackheim', 'Peter Markle', 'David Straiton', 'Elodie Keene', 'Adam Arkin', 'Paul McCrane', 'John Behring', 'Frederick King Keller', 'John Dahl', 'David Semel'], 'Studio': ['NBC']}
Review Text: The Life series was one of those quirky shows that allowed Damian Lewis to hone his skills. Skills which have proven to be superb in Homeland and Band of Brothers just to name two. Sadly Life only lasted 2 seasons, but it did give us two excellent actors in Lewis and Shahi. We can still enjoy both on the small screen today.
Review Title: Life and then some
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Total Recall
Review Date: 2013/01/30
Categories: Science Fiction, Suspense, Compelling, Tense
Product Description: ['A factory worker (Colin Farrell) becomes a hunted man after a procedure goes awry that would convert his dreams of life as a spy into real memories.']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Len Wiseman'], 'Producers': ['Neal H. Moritz', 'Toby Jaffe', 'Neal Moritz'], 'Starring': ['Colin Farrell', 'Leigh Folsom', 'Brian T. Delaney']}
Review Text: Enjoyed the twists that were different from the original and the Special Effects were excellent. The acting was so so but so was the acting in the original.
Review Title: Good Special effects sub-par acting
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/06/01
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Nutter', 'Alan Taylor', 'Alex Graves', 'Miguel Sapochnik', 'Mark Mylod', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Brian Kirk'], 'Producers': ['Mark Huffam', 'Carolyn Strauss', 'Joanna Burn', 'Frank Doelger', 'Guymon Casady', 'George R.R. Martin', 'Ralph Vicinanza', 'Vince Gerardis'], 'Starring': ['Sean Bean', 'Mark Addy', 'Peter Dinklage'], 'Studio': ['Discovery Global']}
Review Text: Was pleasantly surprised at the good flow of the movie story line in conjunction with the book. The gritty nature of the filming gave validity to the real nature of the times and made the story that much more compelling. Looking forward to the rest of the episodes in season 1.
Review Title: Very good at bringing the books to life
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/06/01
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Euros Lyn', 'Paul McGuigan'], 'Producers': ['Sue Vertue', 'Beryl Vertue', 'Steven Moffat', 'Mark Gatiss', 'Rebecca Eaton', 'Bethan Jones'], 'Starring': ['Benedict Cumberbatch', 'Martin Freeman'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']}
Review Text: It is always hard to re-do a classic especially when your attempting to bring classic characters into the twenty first century. Sherlock succeeds in all aspects. It is a role attempted by many and grasped by few. Cumberbatch joins the few who really grasp the Baker Street sleuth's persona.
Review Title: Excellent series with quality actors
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/06/01
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Moore'], 'Producers': ['Alex Young', 'Wyck Godfrey'], 'Starring': ['Bruce Willis', 'Jai Courtney', 'Sebastian Koch'], 'Studio': ['Fox']}
Review Text: The special effects were as advertised, but the story was weak to the extreme. The movie was more for the action junkie than for the thoughtful viewer. I hope for the sake of Mr. Willis' career that he graciously turns down any producer that wants to do another installment.
Review Title: The end of the road?
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/08/19
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Philip Martin'], 'Producers': ['Simon Moseley'], 'Starring': ['Kenneth Branagh', 'Sarah Smart', 'Jeany Spark']}
Review Text: Wallander is a treat for those of us who want to have our gray mater tickled. A smart and complex inter-weaving of plots and subplots makes for great detective stories and character development of the finest kind. The cinematography is stunning and the supporting cast is gritty enough that they are believable. Dark detective work with excellent Ah Ha moments makes for a series that treats the viewer to a quality series to be viewed multiple times.
Review Title: Depressing, grinding, enlightening and superb
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/09/30
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Colm McCarthy', 'Anthony Byrne'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lowe (Element Films)', 'Rob Pursey'], 'Starring': ['Own McDonnell', 'Ian McElhinney']}
Review Text: By offering the viewer more than just shallow character development Single-Handed fleshes out the experience of law enforcement Irish style in a beautiful but rugged landscape. The main characters scrape against each other creating a tension that flows through each stories in the series. If your looking for the cookie cutter American T.V. police or detective stories you'll be wasting your time, but if instead you want something that pushes your mental mystery button Single- Handed may just your cup of tea.
Review Title: Complex characters with interlocking stories make this a good watch.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/09/30
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ["Thaddeus O'Sullivan", 'Charlie McCarthy'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lowe', 'Rob Pursey'], 'Starring': ['Owen McDonnell', 'Matthew McNulty', 'Simone Lahbib'], 'Studio': ['Acorn Media']}
Review Text: Sergeant Driscoll's character gains a number of layers in season two and the intensity of both the mysteries and the personal conflicts create a can't wait for the next episode mindset. I don't know if there will be a third season but the first two have been excellent in both material and scenery.
Review Title: You'll Hate when this series comes to an end!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Average Rating: 4.5

Review Text: Witty and fast paced sorry there was only one season. Looking forward to more.
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0

Review Title: More than a spy story

raw_response:
**SUMMARY:**

The individual exhibits a clear preference for high-quality visual storytelling, particularly in the realms of science fiction, suspense, and gritty dramas. Consistently high ratings (typically 4.4 and above) indicate a strong appreciation for well-crafted narratives and complex character development, with sentiments suggesting a focus on plot depth and emotional engagement. The reviewer often praises intricate storylines that challenge intellect, as reflected in their admiration for cerebral themes.

Common themes across purchases include a fondness for adaptations of literary works and darker, sophisticated narratives. A distinct dislike for superficial or action-heavy productions without substance is evident, showcasing a preference for quality over mere entertainment value.

Quality is a recurring theme; products featuring acclaimed actors and strong production teams garner the highest ratings. While price sensitivity isn't explicitly detailed, the consistent high ratings paired with thoughtful critiques imply a willingness to invest in premium content if it meets their standards for storytelling and acting quality. 

Overall, this person's core preferences revolve around engaging, intellectually stimulating content with a penchant for superb acting and production quality, favoring thought-provoking narratives over conventional entertainment.
